turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about Farnesyltranstransferase.
turn.1: What is the function of Farnesyltransferase?
turn.2: Farnesyltranstransferase In enzymology, a farnesyltranstransferase () is an enzyme that catalyzes the chemical reaction Thus, the two substrates of this enzyme are trans,trans-farnesyl diphosphate and isopentenyl diphosphate, whereas its two products are diphosphate and geranylgeranyl diphosphate.
turn.3: What is the significance of Farnesyltransferase?
turn.4: This enzyme belongs to the family of transferases, specifically those transferring aryl or alkyl groups other than methyl groups.
turn.5: What is the full name of Farnesyltransferase?
turn.6: The systematic name of this enzyme class is trans,trans-farnesyl-diphosphate:isopentenyl-diphosphate farnesyltranstransferase.
turn.7: What are some other names for the same enzyme?
turn.8: Other names in common use include geranylgeranyl-diphosphate synthase, geranylgeranyl pyrophosphate synthetase, geranylgeranyl-PP synthetase, farnesyltransferase, and geranylgeranyl pyrophosphate synthase.
turn.9: What are some examples of the enzyme's biological roles?
turn.10: This enzyme participates in biosynthesis of steroids and terpenoid biosynthesis.
turn.12: This protein may use the morpheein model of allosteric regulation.
